poem:
**Disjointed Harmony**

In Liverpool's heart a murmur stirs—  
mumbles through corridors,   
chaos like thick fog,  
no compass to anchor.  

With each step, a dance of missteps:  
a self-spun web of discord,  
as voices rise, hope flickers dim—  
woven in the echo of disunity,  
a tangled mess we call our own.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘A mess of our own making’: Labour mayors reflect on Starmer’s first year Keir Starmer’s government appears “disjointed” from the rest of the Labour party just a year after taking power, regional mayors have said, with one blaming No 10 for overseeing “a mess of our own making”. Steve Rotheram, the Labour mayor of Liverpool city region, said Downing Street’s repeated missteps were “winding up” people who wanted to back the government. Speaking as the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
